TopicTitle: Got the game from KSPstore can I buy the DLC from GOG

Articles.Content:
Hi everyone!

I'am sorry if anyone already asked it before, but I bought the game from KSPstore, can I buy the DLC from GOG and play it with the store version?

Or I can only use the store version.

Thanks in advance

:)

i would say no

i imagine the steam DLC is going to look for the main game under its common apps folder and not find it which will not install. 

i could be wrong but i wouldnt do it just yet

Who said anything about Steam?

 

It might work.  The GoG installer asks you for your KSP directory.  AFAIK, it just extracts the contents to the GameData folder and installs like a mod.  Will GoG let you buy the DLC without owning their copy of the game?  They should, but I've never tried to buy a DLC without having the game,

 

Why get it through GoG though if you have the store version?  Is there something wrong with the store version?

15 minutes ago, invision said:

doesnt GOG link steam account?

No, they have nothing to do with each other.

DLC from directory perspective is only one folder working like a mod. So here is what I did: I have ksp both on steam and gog, bought the DLC on gog as well. And it installed in its directory, but since I play on Gog version on 1.3, I moved the DLC folder over to where steam version is. And it works there.

However, the DLC version is bound with game, so when either of them updates, you have to update the other as well, otherwise it won't work (at least for me, I didn't see the missions after game updated)

Thanks for your answers, it seems that there is no real answer to it.
